result.execSummary:
The defendant Jared W Anderson was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Disorderly Conduct [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse - Threat], a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.descr: Notice of court ordered financial obligations
Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: cc: DA (electronically), Probation , Defendant by COC w/Amended JOC on 10/3/17. sf

[MK] case called at 11:07am. 
Defendant Jared W Anderson in court.  ADA Theresa Beck appears for the State of Wisconsin, along with Probation Agent Jesse Phelps. 
ADA Beck indicates that the DOC and Mr. Anderson have agreed for extension of the Probation term for six months.  This is because the Department wishes to follow through on completion of treatment-- Mr. Anderson is back in treatment at this time. There is also unpaid costs;  Mr. Anderson has paid $350 toward financial obligations, and he still has approximately $200 to pay.
The Court clarifies that it cannot extend any Probation term for the purpose of paying costs.   
The Court orders extension of the Probation term for six months for the purposes of completing treatment.  If the court financial obligations are still not paid in full at the end of the extended six months, then a civil judgment will be entered for any balance due at that time.
recess 11:11am.
Probation review hearing on September 29, 2017 at 11:00 am.  (Notice was also given to the Agent Jesse Phelps - LZ)
Letter from DOC
Petition and Stipulation to Waive Appearance and Hearing and Judgment for Court Ordered Financial Obligations
DOC Balance Inquiry

records.descr: Notice of court ordered financial obligations

records.addlTxt: Order for payment of Atty. Colleen Locke as appointed defense counsel in the amount of $203 .
with attachments and proposed order for payment of court appointed defense counsel fees from Attorney Colleen Locke in the amount of $203 .
Criminal Case Settlement

Case called at 10:16am [mo]
Defendant Jared W Anderson in court with Attorney Colleen Jane Locke.   ADA Monica Hall appears for the State of Wisconsin.
  
Maximum penalties recited; Constitutional rights reviewed; plea of " NO CONTEST " entered; factual basis stipulated; victim rights compliance verified; the Court accepts the plea, finds Defendant guilty, and orders Judgment of Conviction entered.

ADA Hall submits victim impact statement 
Sentencing arguments given by Counsel
Statement made by Mr. Anderson

The Court withholds sentence, and places Defendant on Probation for 18 months, with conditions as set forth in the Criminal Case Settlement.

[which are:
--no possession of any dangerous weapon 
--complete certified batterers' intervention programming per agent
--no acts or threats of violence
--to pay statutory costs]
Additionally, the Court orders as part of Probation that Mr. Anderson pay court appointed attorney fees

The Court orders Mr. Anderson to submit a DNA sample to JESO, today


Days credit for time already served:  0  days

recess: 10:39am
Status conference on April 5, 2016 at 10:00 am.
Conflict Review Worksheet--No Conflict Found

Case called at 9:30am [mo]
Defendant Jared W Anderson in court.  ADA Theresa A Beck appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
The Court reviews the Court Record; including that Atty. Colleen Locke was appointed as counsel

The Court orders Mr. Anderson to call Atty. Locke to ensure that she will take this appointment and discuss the case.

The Court directs the Clerk to provide Mr. Anderson with a copy of the Order Appointing Counsel.
The Court inquires of Mr. Anderson's current address; he indicates that he is currently living on Water St., but will soon be moving to VanBuren St.; the Court directs the Clerk to enter both addresses and use both addresses until Mr. Anderson provides an updated address or until otherwise directed by the Court. 

The Court orders the State to schedule with Atty. Locke a mutually convenient  status date and time; the conference with the Court's JA to schedule this hearing should occur no later than 4/1/16 at 4:00pm 
The Court discloses, under SCR 60.04 that in the Court's former capacity as Jefferson County District Attorney, attorneys that DA Wambach supervised did prosecute Mr. Anderson. The Court does not feel that any disqualification or recusal is needed.

The Court directs the Clerk to mail Atty. Locke a copy of the minutes from todays hearing, conflict review worksheet and order appointing counsel
recess:9:38am

NEXT: The State and Atty. Locke are to contact the Court's JA
State Public Defender Determination of Financial Eligibility - Defendant not eligible.
Attorney Colleen Locke. Repayment at the rate of $100 per month until the total sum is paid. The first payment shall be made on 4-8-16. Payments shall be made to the Clerk of Court
State Public Defender Determination of Financial Eligibility - Defendant not eligible.
